Now, we need to add a dropdown at the top of the page that has the job types (see /Job/AdvancedSearch), and a button next to it that says "Go".

Here are the steps to complete this (see /RelatedImage for a similar example):

1. Put the select element in a `<form>`.
2. Set that action of the form to the current page (or blank).
3. Set the `name` attribute of the select element to "jobTypeNumber".
4. Make the button an `<input type="submit" />`.

Use [this RSS feed](http://www.olmsted.org/news-and-publications/news/naop-news?format=feed&type=rss) to start with.

In the action, retrieve the feed and parse it into models (create a model called NewsItem). Put these into a list, and pass that to a view model (you may have to create it). Use [this stack overflow response](http://stackoverflow.com/a/3390852/192217) as an example.

I started work on this in a feature branch, but realized that ignoring the scans table has some drawbacks. Particularly, these are the benefits of using the scans table:

* Faster checking for existence.
* Ability to store information about tiles (existence, levels).
* Ability to store geographic location of scan.
* Ability for plans to have multiple scans.

It may make more sense to continue updating the scans table, and add a few extra columns for some of the other needed information.

Be aware that not all plans have Small or Hi-Res images. If the files don't exist, put a blank string for the size in the ViewBag, and use that on the view to indicate whether or not to provide a link.

Support has been added to the PlanController for downloading hi-res images.

Update the Plan/Details action to pass two more items in the ViewBag: WebImageSize, and HighResImageSize. Use C#'s FileInfo class for to get these values, and format them as strings. Sizes less than 1 megabyte should be displayed as kilobytes. Round the megabyte values to one decimal, and the kilobyte values to the whole numbers.

Then add two links in the view's sidebar, one to "Plans/WebImage/{id}" and another to "Plans/HighResImage/{id}". Next to those links should be the respective file sizes.

Example:

    Small JPEG (300kb) | Hi-Res PNG (12.3mb)

issues.title: Resized Image Caching
issues.content:
Resized images should be cached to disk, to prevent the server from having to resize the same images over and over again.

[ImageResizer](http://imageresizing.net), a widely used library for this purpose, does exactly this, with disk caching and more. However, the license is $250.

I believe it's worth the license, as it would take more than half a day to implement caching to disk, and we'd get that feature and many more for the price. Nevertheless, it's something we would need to talk about with John.

issues.title: Explore Map - Query Points based on Extent
issues.content:
Points are currently being queried using Jobs/Mappable, and all points are returned and stored in the browser. This call takes too long.

Instead, the map should query only for points in the current extent, and draw them immediately, instead of storing them in the browser.

The Mappable action should take an extent and be able to do a spatial query on the data.

To get started:

* Create a template page with the header. Ignore the search and menu functionality for now.
* Create the home/map page. Ignore gps, drawing points, or handling point clicks for now.
* Create a static page, like Contact Us.

This help us get some of the initial shared styling out of the way.

issues.title: Glossary Page and Help Links
issues.content:
Create a glossary page to contain definitions of terminology used throughout the site, and also create contextual help links to sections of the glossary page.

The page will be static HTML content, using definition list markup for various terms. See [this MDN article](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/HTML/Element/dl). Each `<dt>` will have an `id` attribute which can be used to link to that particular term.

Add breadcrumb navigation across the site using the `@Html.Breadcrumb()` helper added in commit 1fabf07e. The commit includes a few examples of usage.

issues.title: Fair Use Statement
issues.content:
We need to support multiple fair use statements - based on the source. We will do this by replacing the current image disclaimer with the following:

```
Conditions of authorized download and use of digital copies of materials on this site are outlined in the [Fair Use Policy].
```

The words "Fair Use Policy" should be a link that takes you to an entry in the FAQ (need to create this) that lists the different fair use statements for the various sources.

issues.title: Error page
issues.content:
The site needs a default error page.

An error controller is needed, with an index action (generic error) and a NotFound action (404). Here's the web.config entry:

```xml
<customErrors mode="On" defaultRedirect="~/error">
  <error statusCode="404" redirect="~/error/notfound"/>
</customErrors>
```

NBIG does this already, so code can be pulled from that project.

NAOP has requested that we change the order, and swap images 2 and 3 around.

issues.title: Advanced Search - clarify date search boxes
issues.content:
On the Advanced Search page - under Projects, we allow a user to search by date ranges.

We need to make this more intuitive that a) all we want are the years, and b) that the second box is for the ending year.

Some thought was to shrink the boxes a bit and to put them side by side.

issues.title: Image Details - Hide end date if null
issues.content: On the Image Details page (and the Document Details page) - please hide the "end date" title if there is no date to display.

issues.title: Document Details Page - Doc Type title
issues.content: On the Document Details page - can we have "Document Type" on one line instead of two?

issues.title: Explore map - zoom to site default
issues.content: When you go to Explore the map, find a job site, and click on "zoom to site" - the default zoom level (for when we don't have a size in the database) is too far out.  Can we have the default zoom in one or two more levels.

issues.title: Static timeline
issues.content:
The existing timeline page should be replaced with a new static timeline, which will resemble the timeline page in the design documents more closely.

Attached are documents showing projects and world events to use on the timeline, and a screenshot of the timeline mockup in the design docs.

issues.title: Explore Map - search option text hints
issues.content: Similar to what you did in the Advanced Search window - they would like to have us add the grey text hints inside the search boxes. Especially important for the location box - to remind people to enter in a City and State.

issues.title: Learn More Dropdown
issues.content:
The learn more menu item should show a submenu when hovered over. The options in the submenu should be this:

* Projects & Partners
* Locales (job/statesandcountries)
* Articles
* FAQs
* Glossary (home/glossary)
* About NAOP (http://www.olmsted.org/naop-about/about)

You should still be able to click on the

issues.title: Home Page - styling changes (blue arrows)
issues.content:
On the home page - in the three boxes on the left(Quick Search, Advanced Search, and Explore the Map):

1) Please remove the small light blue rectangles / bullet marks before the wording. 

2) They like the blue arrow we added to the Quick search box. They would like a similar arrow added to the Advanced search box. (just to the right of the words Advanced Search)   Also the arrow in the Explore the Map should be made the same size as the the ones above.

issues.title: Advanced Search - move Job# to top
issues.content:
In the Advanced search tabs - for Projects, Plans, Images, and Documents; they would like to rearrange the search boxes, so that it will read:

```
Find Olmsted Projects by

Job  Number: <input>

       or

Search by one of the criteria below. 
Use multiple fields to narrow down results.
...
...
```

issues.title: Advanced Search - add "or"
issues.content:
Under Advanced Search, on the initial Quick Search tab, they would like us to add a line with "-- or  --" between the Name and Job Number boxes, and again between the name and the Number boxes under Plans.

The reason for this is that users are tying to enter in both a name and a number, and they are often coming up with no results found.

issues.title: Explore the Map - Add Street view links
issues.content: In the Explore the Map view - when a user clicks on a site, the popup box comes up . They would like us to add a link to Google's street view. (Under where it says, zoom to site)

issues.title: Project Type drop down - add "ALL TYPES"
issues.content:
In several locations you can filter by project type (Explore the map, Image Gallery, Advanced Search).  In all of these locations, they would like it to say "All Types" instead of just being blank by default.  

This will also help a user figure out how to undo the filter - currently they need to know to click on the blank line at the top.

issues.title: Advanced Search - change Quick Search to just Search
issues.content:
Under Advanced Search - the default page is Quick Search.

Please change the tab form 'Quick Search" to just 'Search."
The subtitle should be changed from "Quick Search" to "Search:"
The Welcome to... pop up box in the results section should be updated so that on the second line, the word Quick, is not bolded or capitalized.

issues.content:
On the Home Page - under Quick Search, they would like to remove the slide bar for distance. (You can code it to 15 miles if you need to - just don't bother showing the slider...)

Once the user hits go - the Explore the Map view will have the slider if they want to adjust their zoom level there.

Since all those blue boxes on the left will now have some extra space, they asked if we could shrink them all down a bit and make that bottom left map insert a little taller.

issues.title: Project and plan reports
issues.content:
Both the project details page and the plan details page need a report button.

Instead of creating a report page, we will just create a print stylesheet for the existing pages, and use it to toggle and shift elements as necessary. The site header and footer should not be included, although that is generic and should be a site-wide print stylesheet.

For the project/job details page, place a button for "Print Report" in the right sidebar under the small map. The report should include the job information as shown on the details page from the title through the synopsis. Do not include the plan/document/images listings.

For the plan details page, place the button at the bottom of the left sidebar. The report should include all of the plan content, except for the plan navigation buttons.

issues.content:
On the Plan Details pages, in the left hand column, we need to also display:

- Size 
- Technique
- Medium
- Support
- Date(s) (based on ORGODates field)

These fields and the title should only display if there is information in the database for that record.

issues.title: Download plans and images - maintain file names
issues.content:
When you go to the Plan Details page, and download the High Res jpeg version - it maintains the image name (00346-01), but when you try to save the smaller .png (or any of the images from image details) it does not maintain the file name.  Instead it looks like it takes the object number from the database...which is a random number.

Is there any way to have the .png and small images from the gallery keep the original file name when downloaded?

issues.title: Handling unmapped jobs

* Job Details/Map: shows default extent (WA state).

We need a strategy to handle these better.
